entry.title: Shady Rest Golf and Country Club (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Shady Rest Golf and Country Club (pictured) was the home of John Shippen, the first African American to compete in the U.S. Open?

entry.title: Mehmet Şerif Fırat (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after Mehmet Şerif Fırat helped the Turkish military defeat the Sheikh Said rebellion, he was internally exiled with relatives of the leaders of the rebellion?

entry.title: Jews of color (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a report commissioned by the Jews of Color Initiative described "Jews of color" as "an imperfect, but useful umbrella term"?

entry.title: Rob Sand (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Iowa state auditor Rob Sand modeled in Milan and Paris while he was in college?

entry.title: dirge (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the word "dirge" for funeral hymns can be traced to primer prayer books?

entry.title: Chestertown Armory (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Washington College is investigating the possibility of turning the Chestertown Armory into a bed and breakfast?

entry.title: Walter Cockle (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that papyrologist Walter Cockle produced a new edition of a tragedy by Euripides based on fragments found in the Oxyrhynchus Papyri?

entry.title: a Chicago TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a Chicago TV station was expelled from the National Association of Broadcasters by mistake?
